comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do not edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: to_integer
description:
Converts an input value to an integer value.
If the input parameter is of a date type, its value will be interpreted as milliseconds
since the Unix epoch, converted to integer.
Boolean `true` will be converted to integer `1`, `false` to `0`.

params.name: field
params.description: Input value. The input can be a single- or multi-valued column or an expression.

params.description: Input value. The input can be a single- or multi-valued column or an expression.

examples:
ROW str1 = "0x32", str2 = "31"
| EVAL int1 = TO_INTEGER(str1, 16), int2 = TO_INTEGER(str2, 13)
| KEEP str1, int1, str2, int2

ROW str1 = "Kona"
| EVAL int1 = TO_INTEGER(str1, 27), fail1 = TO_INTEGER(str1, 10)
